xt:extension.xt:author: Syncro Soft
xt:extension.xt:name: XSpec Helper view

div.p: This add-on contributes an XSpec Test Results view that provides the ability to run XSpec test scenarios and view the results directly in Oxygen. To use the new view, after installation, open an XSpec file and click the Run XSpec test scenarios button on the toolbar.
This plugin also requires the XSpec Framework. Please install them both.

ol.li: Inside Oxygen XML Editor/Developer, open an XSpec file.
Click the XSpec Run button on the toolbar or use the Run test scenario(s) action from the editor contextual menu.

div.p: Result: An XSpec Test Results view will be opened.
Tip: At this point you can switch to the XSLT and use the Run actions in this view to execute the scenarios.
div.h3: What you can do inside the XSpec Test Results view

ul.li: For each test, there is a Show action that selects the coresponding test in the editor.
For each scenario, there is a Run action that just runs that particular scenario.
For a failed test, you can click on it to open the diff comparison between the expected and actual results.

ol.li: Fixed Saxon 11 classpath issues and API changes that made it crash in Oxygen version 25.0.
Fixed some classpath issues that made it crash in Oxygen version 24.1.
Supports running XSpec tests for XQuery files.
Fixed some classpath issues that made it crash in Oxygen version 22.0.
Fixed bug that didn't allow running XSpec scenarios that needed Saxon EE.
Better handling of witespaces in when presenting the diff. #29
The plugin can now execute Schematron tests.
Activating an Oxygen dark theme will also reflect in the view.
The possibility to rerun only the failed scenario.

xt:extension.xt:author: Syncro Soft
xt:extension.xt:name: XSpec Framework (required by the XSpec Helper view plugin)

div.p: This framework is required for the XSpec Helper view plugin. Both add-ons must be installed.
This add-on contributes a customized version of Oxygen's built-in XSpec framework. The XSpec Helper view add-on uses this framework for XSpec test scenarios.
